entry.title: Henry-Stewart talks goes live
entry.content:
Updates

30/1/2026    Package gaawr2 0.0.5 is released and on CRAN.

URLs

  • HS Talks, https://hstalks.com/expert/1336/dr-jing-hua-zhao/?biosci.
  • CRAN, https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/gaawr2/index.html.
  • GitHub, https://github.com/jinghuazhao/gaawr2.
  • Web site, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/gaawr2/.

Citation (ChatGPT with minor revisions)

The Henry Stewart Talks series shows:

Zhao, J.H. (2026, January 28). Genetic association analysis with R: latest developments. Published in The Biomedical & Life Sciences Collection, Henry Stewart Talks. DOI: 10.69645/FRFQ9519. (HSTalks)

That DOI is the formal reference for this HSTalks lecture and is what you should cite if you want the latest development talk by Dr. Jing Hua Zhao (University of Cambridge) on genetic association analysis using R. (HSTalks)

APA style

Zhao, J. H. (2026, January 28). Genetic association analysis with R: latest developments [Video]. Henry Stewart Talks. https://doi.org/10.69645/FRFQ9519 (HSTalks)

MLA style

Zhao, Jing Hua. “Genetic Association Analysis with R: Latest Developments.” Henry Stewart Talks, 28 Jan. 2026, doi:10.69645/FRFQ9519. (HSTalks)

Vancouver style

Zhao JH. Genetic association analysis with R: latest developments [Internet]. Henry Stewart Talks; 2026 Jan 28 [cited 2026 Jan 28]. Available from: https://doi.org/10.69645/FRFQ9519 (HSTalks)

According to the summary, the talk covers:

  • Updated tools and workflows in R for genetic association analysis
  • R environment and software topics
  • GWAS packages, AI/machine-learning methods, biomaRt annotation
  • Package development and distribution
  • Shiny/GUI tools and web deployment of workflows (HSTalks)

Examples of recent R-related genetic association methods

  • AssocTests: A Journal of Statistical Software article on R tools for genetic association analysis methods. DOI: 10.18637/jss.v094.i05. (jstatsoft.org)

  • netgwas: Implements network-based genome-wide association methods in R. DOI: 10.32614/RJ-2023-011. (The R Journal)

  • topr: An R package for visualising and annotating genetic association results (BMC Bioinformatics 2023). (Springer)

If you want a compact list for inclusion in a manuscript:

Zhao JH. Genetic association analysis with R: latest developments. Henry Stewart Talks; 2026 Jan 28. doi:10.69645/FRFQ9519. (HSTalks) Behrouzi P, Arends D, Wit EC. netgwas: An R package for Network-Based Genome Wide Association Studies. The R Journal. 2023;14(4):18-37. doi:10.32614/RJ-2023-011. (The R Journal) AssocTests: An R Package for Genetic Association Studies. Journal of Statistical Software. 2020;94(5). doi:10.18637/jss.v094.i05. (jstatsoft.org) topr: an R package for viewing and annotating genetic association results. BMC Bioinformatics. 2023;24:268. (Springer)

If you want a short summary paragraph describing the current state of genetic association analysis in R with up-to-date references for a paper or talk, just let me know!

entry.title: Latest Firefox is built on CSD3!

link.title: Latest Firefox is built on CSD3!

entry.content:
These are detailed here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/firefox.html.

As of 20/1/2026, we have from module avail ceuadmin/firefox:

--------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles ----------------------------------------------------
ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7  ceuadmin/firefox/147.0.1  ceuadmin/firefox/148.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/nightly

where nightly points to 148.0a1 on 19/12/2025.

Modules as of 29/9/2025,

--------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles ---------------------------------------------------
ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7  ceuadmin/firefox/143.0.1  ceuadmin/firefox/143.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/145.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/nightly

such that

  • 60.5.1-1.el7 is actually a singularity module.
  • 143.0.1 is the first official release at ceuadmin.
  • 145.0a1 is officially nightly.
  • ceuadmin/firefox/nightly is still a symbolic link to 143.0a1.

The general context is described here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/web.html.

A real-world usage on CSD3 is shown here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/Caprion/.

entry.title: Software for population genetics available
entry.content:
Besides R/rehh and simNGS (https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:simngs) earlier, this kickstarts with these modules:

  1. selscan. Haplotype based scans for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/selscan.html.
  2. angsd. Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/angsd.html.
  3. Relate. Software to estimate genome-wide genealogies for thousands of samples, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/relate.html
  4. CLUES2. A method for inferring and evaluating evidence for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/clues2.html.
  5. fastsimcoal2. Fast sequential Markov coalescent simulation of genomic data under complex evolutionary models, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/fsc2.html.
  6. hapstat. haplotype-disease association, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/hapstat.html.
  7. CCphylo. a software suite designed to easen phylogenetic analysis, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:ccphylo.

entry.title: Sphinx, cambridge-ceu/csd3 & srcf polished
entry.content:
I am pleased to share extensions of two canonical (1 & 2 below) and a customised (3 below) themes,

1. sphinx-rtd-theme

A new repository, sphinx https://github.com/jinghuazhao/sphinx, highlights the long-awaited adoption of the theme incorporating the master logo and link.

2. jekyll-rtd-theme

Inspired by the extension above, the cambridge-ceu/csd3 site https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/ now collapses on the side bar while showing summary information on each category and giving remarkable visual simplification.

3. srcf

The SRCF-style site is showcased here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/srcf/.
